title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:16): I know how we can pick a logo.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:16): disqualify 1, 4, 6, 8, 9, 10, 12, 14, 15, 16, 18, and 20.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:17): then we have 2, 3, 5, 7, 11, 13, 17, and 19  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:18): then we disqualify the first, forth, sixth, and eighth.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:18): then we only have numbers which are a prime number of prime numbers.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:19): 3, 5, 11 and 17  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:19): then we disqualify the first, and forth.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:19): leaving 5 and 11  
sdumitriu - (00:19): 5 it is  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:20): and disqualify the first  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:20): leaving 11  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:20): and announce we have a winner.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:20): The responses would be awesome.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:21): It's a little late but we can still get one good prank in for the day.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:22): I suppose we would have to tell Ciprian that it's not the real thing.  
sdumitriu - (00:23): It's the second here already  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:24): Ahh yes. I'm too late.  
sdumitriu - (00:24): Looks like this year XWiki didn't organize a mass prank  
mflorea - (00:25): sdumitriu: ActionFilter is mapped to /\*, why not only to the action servlet?  
sdumitriu - (00:26): No idea  
sdumitriu - (00:26): Let me check if it was changed  
mflorea - (00:27): comparing to SetCharacterEncoding filter which is general, and is useful for any request (including rest requests for instance), ActionFilter is related to the action servlet.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:29): xkcd is pretty good.  
sdumitriu - (00:29): It was always mapped to /\*  
sdumitriu - (00:30): But yes, it would only make sense for the struts action at the moment  
mflorea - (00:31): ok, I'll change locally and see if there are any side effects  
jvelociter joined #xwiki at 00:34  
sdumitriu - (00:35): CalebJamesDeLisl: in xkcd, try sudo reboot  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:35): It won't talk to me anymore after sudo rm -rf /  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:37): haha that's cool. what no  sudo halt?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:37): su is funny too.  
sdumitriu - (00:38): make me a sandwich  
lucaa - (00:38): sdumitriu: I tried su root, didn't help  
lucaa - (00:39): also try help, it's cool  
sdumitriu - (00:42): wget http://google.com  
lucaa - (00:42): google's translate for animals was also cool today  
lucaa - (00:42): (if we're in april fool hall of fame mode)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:43): :(){ :|:& };: works.  
sdumitriu - (00:44): man man  
lucaa - (00:45): man anything  
sdumitriu - (00:45): man cat  
sdumitriu - (00:45): man next  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:48): vi  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:48): or emacs  
lucaa - (00:49): of course  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:49): ed  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:50): ]echo  
lucaa - (00:52): pwd  
lucaa - (00:53): sudo apt-get upgrade  
lucaa - (00:53): sudo apt-get moo  
lucaa - (00:54): (and many nice others, from http://github.com/chromakode/xkcdfools/blob/master/xkcd\_cli.js of course)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (01:05): find kitten  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (01:09): Hmm, that page isn't everything rm -rf / says something.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (01:09): As with the fork bomb above.

factor - (05:31): xwiki is really nice.. what is the main xwiki web page skin and config and does the wiki show how to set it up like that?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (06:18): The default skin is Colibri, there are a couple of others, xwiki.org uses one called Toucan, there are 2 or three others, they are old and not tested as well, I wouldn't recommend them.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (06:20): You can set the skin in the administration application (upper left corner, xwiki-->administor wiki) or you can preview a different skin by appending ?skin=toucan to the url  
Denis left at 07:03 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds  
factor - (07:08): was wondering about all the different panes and windows to enable or disable  
factor - (07:08): disable the header for example  
Denis joined #xwiki at 07:08  
factor - (07:10): like if you wanted to disable all except the actual wiki page itself. as well and its borders.  
factor - (07:12): just say generally I like xwiki always could be better but really good work, I am used to zope plone , not a fan of plone which xwiki is like for the same reason .  
factor - (07:13): tomcat has no zope like interface by default.  
factor - (07:13): access to eacvh file thru web interface.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (07:27): Most of the UI stuff is controlled from a set of templates in the war file. They are in /templates/\*.vm  
factor - (07:28): oh nice  
factor - (07:28): thanks

mflorea - (10:47): Hi vmassol. I'm trying the BulletinBoard app on XE 2.3 SNAPSHOT and I get "Failed to execute macro: htmlorg.xwiki.rendering.macro.MacroExecutionException: When using the HTML macro inline, you can only use inline HTML content. Block HTML content (such as tables) cannot be displayed. Try leaving an empty line before and after the HTML macro. " when viewing the BBClassSheet. This is the code http://pastebin.com/7X7GyvcH . I tried adding empty lines before and a  
mflorea - (10:56): tmortagne: maybe you have any hints  
tmortagne - (11:02): (finishing something and i'm looking, try wiki=false in your velocity macro to check was is the parsed content)  
mflorea - (11:03): ok  
mflorea - (11:09): strange, no nested HTML macros. http://pastebin.com/SVA5jhnq . There's just one HTML macro, and it can't be rendered..  
mflorea - (11:11): :| the problem was generated by a new line after the velocity macro.. how come?  
mflorea - (11:13): if I take the initial content imported from the BB xar and remove the empty line after the velocity macro the page is displayed fine..  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 11:15  
tmortagne - (11:26): mflorea: the parser takes the \n as an inline content in this case and produce a paragraph with the macro followed by the newline

vmassol - (14:36): guys, ok for me to upgrade myxwiki to the latest 2.3 snapshot?  
tmortagne - (14:37): +1  
sdumitriu - (14:41): +1  
lucaa - (14:43): +1  
jvdrean - (14:43): +1  
vmassol - (14:43): jvdrean: the instructions don't seem to work btw  
vmassol - (14:43): (first time I'm trying them)  
jvdrean - (14:44): which part ?  
lucaa left at 14:44 (Quit: Leaving.  
vmassol - (14:44): step 3 for ex  
vmassol - (14:44): it seems to me you need to remove the current symlink for it to work  
jvdrean - (14:44): there shouldn't be a xwiki.new symlink  
vmassol - (14:45): ah that's because someone didn't do step 8  
jvdrean - (14:45): see step 8)  
vmassol - (14:45): also do you know why the xwiki symlink  
vmassol - (14:46): doesn't point to xwiki-enterprise-web-2.3-20100319.155010-239 ?  
vmassol - (14:46): (but to an older xwiki-enterprise-web-2.3-20100318.144326-234)  
tmortagne - (14:47): looks like a mistake  
vmassol - (14:48): ok I'll remove it  
tmortagne - (14:48): or unfinished upgrade  
vmassol - (14:48): in step 4c do we agree that I should remove the annotation jar copy since it's now part of the platform?  
tmortagne - (14:49): i guess  
vmassol - (14:49): ok doc updated  
vmassol - (15:10): tmortagne: do I need to upgrade the app manager or wiki manager plugins/apps?  
tmortagne - (15:10): vmassol: no  
vmassol - (15:11): ok  
tmortagne - (15:11): note that you can upgrade myxwiki.org using XEM build  
vmassol - (15:11): too late  
florinciu left at 15:12 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
vmassol - (15:13): typo in the doc  
vmassol - (15:13):  sudo find -type f -exec chmod 664 {} ;  
vmassol - (15:13): is not correct  
vmassol - (15:13): it should be  
vmassol - (15:13):  sudo find -type f -exec chmod 664 {} \;  
vmassol - (15:13): fixing  
DV left at 15:16 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds  
arkub left at 15:18 (Ping timeout: 252 seconds  
vmassol - (15:19): hmmm  
vmassol - (15:20): we're going to break all wikis right? (because of the NL bug that was fixed)  
tmortagne - (15:20): probably  
tmortagne - (15:20): some pages at least  
vmassol - (15:24): tmortagne: do you have the exact list of these pages in the release notes?  
vmassol - (15:24): (so that we can at least point users to them)  
vmassol - (15:24): http://myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/AllDocs fails  
vmassol - (15:25): http://myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Dashboard too  
tmortagne - (15:25): easy to find list of pages i fixed but they where not all broken (for most of them is was just invalid XHTML issue)  
tmortagne - (15:26): important ones are:  
tmortagne - (15:26): \* recent changes  
tmortagne - (15:26): \* AllDocs sub pages  
tmortagne - (15:26): \* user profile sub pages  
tmortagne - (15:28): (and no i did not list them in the release note, there is no release note page for 2.3M2 yet)  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 15:30  
arkub joined #xwiki at 15:37  
vmassol - (15:46): tmortagne: you remember the jira issue for the NL fix?  
vmassol - (15:47): (so that I can put it in the mail)  
tmortagne - (15:47): let me find it  
tmortagne - (15:50): vmassol: http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-5050  
vmassol - (15:50): th  
vmassol - (15:50): xs  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 15:55  
vmassol - (16:06): lucaa: can you remind me what to do to get the annotations on a new wiki?  
vmassol - (16:08): ok myxwiki.org upgrade all done  
vmassol - (16:08): let's see how many angry users we get now....  
sdumitriu - (16:10): vmassol: mflorea, lucaa and jvdrean agree that we should just proceed with 12 and 15 included in the second round  
sdumitriu - (16:11): I'm sending the mail, OK?  
vmassol - (16:11): not for me  
sdumitriu - (16:11): Well, democracy wins  
sdumitriu - (16:11): We must reach a consensus  
vmassol - (16:11): we need to agree that if the vote chooses 12 or 15 then they'll be chosen  
vmassol - (16:11): there's no point in sending a vote before we agree on this  
sdumitriu - (16:11): Yes  
sdumitriu - (16:12): They will, but it means that the voters don't find them too similar  
sdumitriu - (16:12): (to other existing logos)  
vmassol - (16:12): voters don't care  
vmassol - (16:12): they won't be the ones to suffer  
sdumitriu - (16:12): I updated the page, please re-read it  
mflorea - (16:12): Their are not my favorite, but we should have dropped them from the start if they were not good. I'm afraid that some won't like the fact that the logo they have voted for is now removed because is not good..  
vmassol - (16:12): yes exactly marius  
vmassol - (16:13): that's why we must redo a vote without them  
sdumitriu - (16:13): We can't just start again  
vmassol - (16:13): it's not their problem  
vmassol - (16:13): I don't see a pb with redoing it  
vmassol - (16:13): it's our problem  
vmassol - (16:13): if they don't want to revote so be it  
vmassol - (16:13): it's not like we're having fun or something  
vmassol - (16:13): this is about legal stuff  
vmassol - (16:14): they don't get to choose  
Denis - (16:14): vmassol: where do you see a legal issue ?  
vmassol - (16:14): I'll repeat what I said  
sdumitriu - (16:14): Voters decide if it's too similar or not  
vmassol - (16:14): either we ask advice for someone who can tell us whether it's legally acceptable or not  
vmassol - (16:15): or we remove any logo that offers a known ressemblance  
vmassol - (16:15): Denis: trademark infringements  
sdumitriu - (16:15): vmassol: Then for all proposed logos we should submit them to a trademark registry authority and have them legally checked  
vmassol - (16:15): it's not like this  
vmassol - (16:15): there are some for which we \*already\* know that they are very close  
vmassol - (16:16): we can't ignore them  
sdumitriu - (16:16): What guarantees that another logo, voted and used for 2 years, won't get sued because Bidibum SARL already has a trademark on it?  
vmassol - (16:16): for those we don't know about it's ok  
vmassol - (16:16): that's fine we'll change it  
vmassol - (16:16): but you can't do something for which you know there's a pb  
vmassol - (16:16): or think there's a pb  
Denis - (16:16): for 12, if xwiki SAS would like to sue, I could understand, but would it ?  
tmortagne - (16:17): problem with 15 is not that it's similar some some other logo, the problem is that it's similar to our main competitor  
vmassol - (16:17): Denis: right now no, if it's bought by some other company, who knows  
vmassol - (16:17): sdumitriu: we could also do this  
tmortagne - (16:17): so i really don't care if someone is not appy that its remove now and not before the first vote  
vmassol - (16:17): don't care about trademakr infringments  
Denis - (16:17): for 15, I really do not see an issue, or many other people logo would already be sued  
vmassol - (16:17): and if someone says something redo a vote and change the logo  
vmassol - (16:18): Denis: for 15, I don't see it's fair that Y wasn't included and 15 was  
tmortagne - (16:18): it's not about being sued for me  
tmortagne - (16:18): i really don't care about that  
tmortagne - (16:18): main main concern is that user don't see our log and thing "that's the open source copy of confluence"  
Denis - (16:18): Y was clearly more close, because it was straight like the one from atlassian  
vmassol - (16:19): yes it was straight like an X ;)  
tmortagne - (16:19): and 15 for me is not more than round version of atlassian logo  
Denis - (16:19): I would have excluded it, but 15 is really curved, and in a different position  
sdumitriu - (16:19): But it's way too different  
sdumitriu - (16:19): I really don't see the similarity  
vmassol - (16:19): sdumitriu: ok I'll stop here, just go ahead. I don't mind chznging the logo again later if need be  
tmortagne - (16:20): the important thing is not that some thing it's not similar but that some thing it is, when we are not sure we should go the remove way IMO  
tmortagne - (16:21): s/thing/think/  
Denis - (16:21): tmortagne:  and 12 is l  
Denis - (16:21): oups  
Denis - (16:21): tmortagne: and 12 is similar to Attlassian with for heads ?  
Denis - (16:22): -for+four  
vmassol - (16:23): myxwiki.org is quite slow....  
sdumitriu - (16:24): Denis: 12 seems similar to the current XWiki.com logo, which is owned by the XWiki SAS company, and not by the XWiki open source community  
Denis - (16:24): tmortagne: similarity is matter of taste, you may always found similarity somewhere, especially with attlasian because they have a logo with a X shape,  
Denis - (16:24): sdumitriu: I completely agree on that  
tmortagne - (16:24): Denis: 12 is not a blue human  
sdumitriu - (16:25): All proposed logos are similar to the Xerox logo, so none of them is good  
Denis - (16:25): tmortagne: 15 is not a straight X, and not a human with the world on his shoulder  
sdumitriu - (16:25): All letter logos are similar to other letter logos  
sdumitriu - (16:25): Every letter has at least one famous company using it in their logo  
sdumitriu - (16:26): And most fruits too  
sdumitriu - (16:26): And most animals  
sdumitriu - (16:26): So no logo is good  
sdumitriu - (16:26): OK, no more logo  
tmortagne - (16:26): Denis: look at confluence logo, not atlassian one  
sdumitriu - (16:26): We just declare that XWiki doesn't have a logo for fear of being sued  
tmortagne - (16:26): Denis: the human doe snot have the world on his shoulder  
vmassol - (16:27): sdumitriu: this is not correct. You can trademark a letter. You can trademark letter written in a specific font, with specific colors, etc  
Denis - (16:27): tmortagne: but it is a straight X  
vmassol - (16:27): s/can/can't/  
Denis - (16:27): with some circle under  
tmortagne - (16:27): Denis: 15 is just a curved version of the same thing  
Denis - (16:27): still nothing to do with a happy man very curved  
mflorea - (16:27): sdumitriu, Denis: I really think we should stand out and having a logo that some can say it copies the main competitor is not the right way..  
vmassol - (16:28): sdumitriu: anyway as I said I'm fine with the strategy: let's continue with round2, use whatever logo is chosen, and change it later on if someone asks us to do so  
mflorea - (16:28): I'd like us to be different  
vmassol - (16:28): hey guys I'm trying to help sergiu now  
vmassol - (16:28): so don't say the opposite now :)  
sdumitriu - (16:28): Yes, I agree, but let the democracy decide that we don't want that logo  
sdumitriu - (16:29): Why do you have to assume that they will be chosen?  
tmortagne - (16:30): Denis: you can find as many minor difference you want, we are not in court, the only thing i see is that it's obvious for me and for other that it's similar and that's enough IMO  
sdumitriu - (16:30): Given the right arguments, making your concerns heard, do you think that people will still blindy vote with those logos?  
sdumitriu - (16:30): And if yes, then maybe there really is no problem, the logos are not that similar  
sdumitriu - (16:30): One, two people seeing the similarity doesn't make them 100% similar  
Denis - (16:30): tmortagne: 12E is really nearer to XWiki SAS compare to 15 and Attlasian, and I would completely under if XWiki SAS would like to see it removed. On the other hand, I nearly sure Attlassian would have difficult to sue us, or find it is similar, the intend really differ  
sdumitriu - (16:30): Don't you trust the community?  
vmassol - (16:31): sdumitriu: given these arguments people would have picked other logos  
sdumitriu - (16:31): If you don't trust a vote to come with the right answer, then you don't trust votes, and why do we even vote anyway?  
mflorea - (16:31): sdumitriu: I'm afraid that people will vote only subjectively without considering the constraints the logo should satisfy  
vmassol - (16:31): which were not picked and that's unfair  
Denis - (16:32): mflorea: I have vote 15, and I have considered the constraints  
tmortagne - (16:32): Denis: again i don't care about being sued or not, i just don't want user to think we are stilling confluence logo because that's what i would think  
vmassol - (16:32): that's why either we say go ahead and accept all the logos if votes or we redo a vote removing the logo with potential issues  
vmassol - (16:32): s/votes/voted/  
Denis - (16:33): mflorea: I just do not see it as similar or confusing, and I feel it is really nice and shows that XWiki is about poeple sharing  
tmortagne - (16:34): Denis: even if we can find arguments to explain it's not that similar i just to want use have to find theses arguments at all  
sdumitriu - (16:35): evalica: Are you here?  
evalica - (16:35): yeap  
evalica - (16:36): sorry .. let me read :)  
Denis - (16:37): tmortagne: really do not have that feeling, and not all user of XWiki even know about the confluence logo. 15 is a curved X, a W and a I dot, a happy jumping man, … this is what I see. Attlassian is a man straight on his foot, in the middle of a circle, with his harm up to the sky, his head is not detached, is has various line thinkness, … there many arguments, but I have just evoked them because you find it similar, not because they are :)  
mflorea - (16:37): Denis: I understand your point but still think that we should choose an original logo, and not something that others have though about.  
sdumitriu - (16:37): The debate is about proposals 12 and 15; Vincent thinks that 12 resembles the current logo too much and should be discarded, tmortagne thinks that 15 resembles Atlassian too much and should be discarded  
sdumitriu - (16:37): So, options are:  
sdumitriu - (16:37): 1/ elliminate 12 and 15 now, although they are the most popular, and continue the second round with the following 3-4 most voted proposals  
sdumitriu - (16:37): 2/ elliminate 12 and 15 and start the vote again  
sdumitriu - (16:37): 3/ keep them and live with the result; we also put a warning in front of these logos  
sdumitriu - (16:39): evalica: WDYT?  
Denis - (16:40): mflorea:  this one is also similar then: http://wigab.com/images/site/2007-01/blog/44-Cingular\_Dropped\_Out.jpg  
tmortagne - (16:40): Denis: i understood that you did not find the logos similar and i'm not trying to prove you it is, i'm explaining why that's the first thing that came to my mind and that i'm sure i'm not the only one. My point is that i want our logo to have nothing to do with Confluence logo and that nobody can doubt it.  
Denis - (16:40): and I pretty sure we will found tons of them, since an X and a man has many things in common  
mflorea - (16:40): yes, and I don't like it either  
mflorea - (16:41): it doesn  
mflorea - (16:41): it doesn't have to be an X  
mflorea - (16:41): or a man  
Denis - (16:42): tmortagne: never came my mind, even after being suggest that I shoud take care  
vmassol - (16:42): sdumitriu: I've changed my mind  
vmassol - (16:42): (I told you to go ahead)  
tmortagne - (16:42): Denis: i don't say it's possible to find the perfect logo that doe snot look like any other logo, i'm just talking about our main contributor logo here, I think that's pretty good reason to be extra safe...  
Denis - (16:43): tmortagne:  ok, so, why not asking them if they have the same feeling then ?  
evalica - (16:44): proposal 19 is similar to http://www.xamance.fr/  
evalica - (16:44): :)  
sdumitriu - (16:44): From http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/LogoChallengeRound2#HProposal12A : Some people feel that this logo resembles the XWiki SAS logo.  Only vote for this logo if you don't find it too similar.  
evalica - (16:45): so 16 wins :)  
gvallarelli - (16:45): I think that evaluating all the problems involved proposal 4 is the best  
evalica - (16:46): the thing is that is unfair to us to remove logos, even though people voted for them.  
evalica - (16:46): the advantage of us is that we can make up our minds and gather all commiters vote :) and settle things out  
sdumitriu - (16:47): Yes, this is a maleable democracy  
evalica - (16:47): I don't want either that we have a logo that is so much similar to Atlassian ... that would be a killer for us in a bad way
